action.primary: Warms Lung Qi, resolves Phlegm and calms wheezing

indications: Wheezing and asthma from Cold-Phlegm, especially in those with underlying Kidney Yang Deficiency
Wheezing and shortness of breath from Lung consumption

action.primary: Tonifies the Kidneys, tonifies Yang and grasps Qi

indications: Coldness and pain of the feet
Wheezing and shortness of breath from insufficient Kidney Yang

contraindications: Excessive or prolonged use can result in stagnation of Stomach Qi.
Prolonged use can result in sexual Excess.

useCases: Impotence with aches and pains in the lower back and legs
Wheezing and shortness of breath from Kidney Yang Deficiency
Shortness of breath from Lung consumption
Insufficient lactation due to insufficient Jing and Blood
Impotence and spermatorrhea due to Kidney Yang Deficiency

notes: Because this herb is heavy, it descends Lung Qi.
It is described as "fierce and rapid".
This herb is said to have rapid results in treating spermatorrhea and erectile dysfunction.
Calcined Stalactite Tips Duan Zhong Ru Shi more strongly tonifies Kidney Yang and is used for wheezing due to Kidneys Unable to Grasp Qi and impotence.
This herb is also used as a calcium supplement for women with hypocalcemia.
This herb is also named E Guan Shi which is smaller and more slender than Zhong Ru Shi.
